Mayiko onse anakana mphekeserayi kwa atolankhani a African mediapa nkhani ya kulanda kwa China bwaloli.

translation.en: Loan repayment measures  Neighboring Kenya had received a $4.5 billion loan to build a railway from Nairobi to the port city of Mombasa, and China indicates it will redo the terms after a committee of the African countrys parliament found that operating losses and debt to Chinese banks were straining taxpayers.
translation.nya: Kabwezedwe a ngongole kumbali ya Kenya kunalandira ngongole ya 4.5 billion kuti imange njanji yochokera ku Nairobi kufkira dooko la mu mzinda wa Mombasa ndipo dziko la China likuonetsa kuti iyang'ananso ndondomeko ndi mgwirizano patatha bungwe la African country's parliament kupeza kuti kusapindura ndi ngongole ku ma banki a China imavulaza opeleka msonkho.

translation.en: Some analysts have warned that opaque lending terms means China could eventually seize infrastructure should countries struggle to meet repayments
translation.nya: Oyikira ndemanga enaachenjenjeza China kamba ka ndondomeko zobwereketsera zosaoneka bwinobwino zomwe zikutanthauza kuti China itha kulanda zomangidwazo pamene mayiko obwerekawa atalephera kukwanilitsa kubweza

translation.en: U.S. and British officials say, "debt traps," where countries cannot raise enough money to repay Chinas loans, are structured to give Beijing leverage over time. Last month, the head of Britains Secret Intelligence Service, Richard Moore, in an interview with BBC Radio 4 said Beijing can acquire "significant ports which have the potential to become naval facilities etcetera."
translation.nya: Owira ntcito ku U.Skomanso ochokeraku Britain ati "misampha ya ngongole,"" pamene mayiko sangakwanitse kupeza ndalama zokwanira kubweza ngongole za dziko la China inaknzedwa kuti adzapeleke mwayi kwa Beijing kwaka nthawi. Mwezi watha, wamkulu wa Britains Secret Intelligent Service, Richard Moore, pocheza ndi BBC Radio 4 anati Beijing ithakupezapo ma dooko anangapo omwe ali ndi kuthekera kokhala podutsitsira zinthu pa sitima ndi zin zotero."

translation.en: Sri Lanka earlier this year passed legislation that critics say will give China control over a key deep-water port that Beijing financed.
translation.nya: kumayambiliro kwa chaka chino, dziko la Sri lanka inakhonza kulembetsa komwe ena otsutsa ati zipeleka mphamvu kwa dziko la China kwa dooko lofunikira la pansi pa madzilomwe Beijing inapeleka ndalama zake.

translation.en: But that has not happened so far in Africa, where Chinese diplomats reject seizures are a part of Beijings strategy.
translation.nya: Koma izi sizinachitikeko ku Africa chiyambileni pomwe anthu oimilira dziko la  China anakana kuti kulanda ndi dongosolo la Beijng

translation.en: "Not a single project in Africa has ever been "confiscated" by China because of failing to pay Chinese loans. On the contrary, China firmly supports and is willing to continue our efforts to improve Africa's capacity for home-driven development," stated the Chinese Embassy in Uganda.
translation.nya: Palibe olo ntchito olo imodzi ku Africa yomwe inalandidwapo ndi dziko la China chifukwa cholephera kubweza ngongole. Kusiyana ndi izi, dzikola China limathandizira komansondilofuna kuitiliza ntchito zake kupitsa Africa patsogolo kuthekera kwa Africa kuti itukuke, anatero kazembe wa China ku Uganda.

translation.en: Instead of seizing assets, Beijing will likely extend deadlines for loan repayment or rework payback terms such as interest rates, analysts told VOA. Those measures would avert takeovers of the infrastructure itself and in turn preserve Chinas reputation in Africa where trade and lending have bested its superpower rival in dollar terms.
translation.nya: Mmalo molanda chumacho, Beijing mwachidziwikire iwonjezera nthawi yomalizirakubweza ngongole kapena kukonzansondondomeko za mabwezedwe monga banyira, anatero katswiri ozukuta nkhaniyi pouza VOA.Ndondomeko zimenezo ziletsa kulanda zomangidwazo ndipo mbali inayi zikonza mbili ya China ku Africa kome malonda ndikubwerekana kuli ndi mphamvu yayikulu motsutsana ndi ndalama ya kwa azungu.

translation.en: To confiscate any assets, including minerals, would "confirm peoples initial biases of China as a neocolonial actor," Jili said, and risk upsetting diplomatic ties with "some of the few friends that China has on the global stage."
translation.nya: Kuti tilande katundu aliyense kuphatikizira miyala ya mtengo wapatali zitha kutsimikiza kukondera koyambilira kwa anthu konena kuti China ndi dziko lofuna kulanda ena ulamuliro," Jili anatero, ndipo chiopsezo chosokoneza maubale ndi mayiko a kunja ndi abale ochepa omwe dziko la China lili nawo pa dziko lonse."

translation.en: "From the China side, its about getting access to new possible markets and expanding both economic activity — also the diplomatic relation," he said.
translation.nya: yakuthekera kumisika yatsopano komanso kukulitsa nkhani zachuma mbali zonse komanso ubale wa maiko, anatero..

translation.en: Chinese loan concerns
translation.nya: Madando okhudzana ndi ngongole zopelekedwa ndi anthu a ku China

translation.en: China encourages lending to Africa in search of high returns on investments and a global reputation as a supporter of poor countries, said Edward Miguel, Oxfam professor in Environmental Resource Economics at the University of California, Berkeley. It is trying to "equal the U.S." as a donor country, he said.
translation.nya: Dziko la China limalimbikitsa kubwereketsa ndalama ku mayiko a mu Africa pofuna zopindulitsa zambili pa zobzyala komanso mbili ya bwino pa dziko lonse lapansi yothandiza mayiko osauka., anatero Edward Miguel,mphunzitsi wa Environmental Resources Economics pa university ya Califonia ku Berkeley.  Ikuyesera kufanana ndi U.S"  ngati diko lopereka, anatero

translation.en: However, China differs from other international lenders and donors mainly for its relative lack of transparency that raises questions in Africa as well as in the West, Miguel believes.
translation.nya: Komabe, dziko la China  limasiyana ndimayiko ena obwereketsa ndiwothandiza makamaka chifukwa chakusowa kauniuni komanso kuika poyera zinthu zomwe zimabweretsa mafunso ku Africa komansokumayiko aazungu, Miguel anakhulupilira choncho.

translation.en: Unlike loans from western governments or international lending bodies like the World Bank, which require labor and environmental safeguards on financed projects, Chinas aid and loans to Africa have been described as "no strings attached," which has been attractive for many countries.  But African nations, especially with economies slipping because of the impacts of COVID-19, face increasing trouble paying back loans, said Hannah Ryder, senior associate with the Africa Program at the U.S. think tank Center for Strategic and International Studies.
translation.nya: Kupatula ngongole zochokera kwa azungu, kapena mabungwe obwereketsa apadziko lonse lapansi  monga World Bank , zomwe zimafunika ntchito komanso kuteteza za chilengedwe  pa ntchito zopatsilidwa ndalama, chithandizo cha China ndi ngongole zopita ku Africa zinafotokozedwa ngati "zilibe cholowa kwa opeleka," zomwe zinakopa mayiko ambili.Koma mayiko a ku Africa makamaka omwe chuma chawo n'chovutika chifukwa cha COVID 19, amakumana ndi zovuta kubweza ngongole, anatero Hannah Ryder,Senior associate wa African Program at U.S think tank for strategic and international studies

translation.en: "China and other countries are becoming more sophisticated in bargaining with one another," wrote Deborah Brautigam of the School of Advanced International Studies at Johns Hopkins University and Harvard Business School's Meg Rithmire in a joint article.
translation.nya: " Dziko la China ndi mayiko ena akukhala ovuta kumvetsetsa mukupanga malonda opindulira onse," analemba Deborah Brautigamwa ku Shool of advance International studiesku John Hopkins University ndi Havard Business School mu zolemb limodzi.

translation.en: Residents in Dakar, Senegal, where the 500-person Forum on China-Africa Cooperation meeting took place on November 29-30, want more Chinese-funded infrastructure but without debt levels like those of the 1990s, Ryder noted.
translation.nya: Anthu okhala ku Dakar, Senegal, komwe bwalo la anthu 500 pa mkumano wa mgwirizano wa China ndi AFRICA (China-Africa cooperation meeting) unachitika mu November kuchokera pa 29 mpaka pa 30, akufuna zomangidwa zothandizidwa ndi ndalama zochokera kwa anthu a ku China koma popanda milingo ya ngongole ngati ya mma 1990, Ryder anazindikiraichi.

translation.en: Chinese creditors are expected to lend less money to Africa going forward and more carefully analyze the projects those loans support, experts say. Loans have already "sobered down" [tapered off] from a peak in 2014, Jili said.
translation.nya: Obwereketsa ndalama aku China akuyembekezeredwa kubwereketsa ndalama zochepa kutsogolo kunokomanso osamalitsa polingalira kuti ndi tchito zanji ngongolezo zitathandizire, akatswiri atero. Ngongole zatsika kuchokera pamwamba mu 2014, Jili anatero

translation.en: Commitments for loans and other investments made at the China-Africa Cooperation meeting came to $40 billion, one-third less than the $60 billion made at the same conference in 2018.
translation.nya: Kudzipeleka pa ngongole ndi zinthu zina zomwe zinapangidwa ku mkumano wa Africa-China Cooperation kunafika pa $40 billion, kutsika ndi gawo limodzi pa magawo atatu poyelekezera ndi $60 billion yomwe inapangidwa pa mkumano ngati omwewu mu chaka cha 2018.

translation.en: Lenders may calibrate loans based on predictions of a post-pandemic future when African countries have more cash, said Yun Sun, co-director of the East Asia program at the Stimson Center in Washington. Another option, she said, is to ensure Chinese equity from future projects as repayment for older loans, she said in a VOA interview.
translation.nya: Obwereketsa ndalama atha kuyeza ngongole pa kulosera za nthawi yamtsogolo mlili wa COVID 19 ukadzapita pamene mayiko a ku Africa adzakhale ndi ndalama zambili, anatero Yun Sun, otsogoleranawo wa East Asia Programku Stimson Center ku Washington. China ndichakuonetsetsetsa kusasiyanitsa pa anthu a ku China pa ntchito zamtsogolomonga kuombola ngongole zakale, iye anatero mu kucheza kwake ndi a VOA.

translation.en: "Its politically risky, because although its not an equity-asset swap, it smells a lot like some sort of swap, and [that] China is exploiting Africas weak position, so I dont think it will happen in the immediate future and in fact this debt restructuring is also taking quite a while," Sun said.
translation.nya: "ichi ndi chiopsezo pa ndalechifukwa ngakahale kusinthanaku sikofanana, zikuoneka ngati ndi kusinthana, ndipo kuti China ikupindulapo pa mavuto a Africa, choncho sindikuganiza kuti izi zichitika pompano ndipo chilungamo chake ndi chakuti kuumbanso kwa ngongole iyi kukutenganso nthawi," Sun anatero

translation.en: China is becoming more confident all the while in setting up international public-private partnerships, though many African countries still worry about a repeat of the debt crisis in the 1980s and 1990s when nations could not pay off debt, Ryder says in an African Business commentary. International organizations ultimately wrote off that wave of unaffordable debt with conditions including opening "their economies to international trade, liberalize their currencies and drastically cut costs in exchange for loans," wrote Peter Fabricius in the Institute for Security Studies.
translation.nya: China ikuyamba kulimba mtima mu nthawi yonseyi pakupanga maubale ndi mayiko a kunja ngakhale mayiko ambili a ku Africa akanai ndi nkhawa zokhudzana ndi vuto lakubwereza kwa ngongole mu zaka za ma 1980 ndi mma 1990 pamene mayiko anakanika kubweza ngongole, Yrdey akutero mu ndemanga yake  mu African Business Commentary.Mabungwe a mayiko angapo anazichotsa izi zakuti mphepo ya ngongole zosakwanitsika zomwe zili ndi zifukwa kuphatikizapo kutsegura chuma chawo ku malonda ndi mayiko ena ,..............., komanso kutsitsa mitengo kwambili posinthana ndi ngongole," Peter Fabrics analemba mu Institute for Security Studies.

translation.en: Fast forward to the present, with loans from China, African countries, Miguel said, often end up asking "what did we agree to do" and "how much do we owe" China.
translation.nya: Kubwera mtsogolokufika pano, ndi ngongole zopelekedwa ndi dziko la China, mayiko a ku Africa nthawi zambili amathera kupempha, anatero Miguel, "Tinavomera kuti tidzatani" komanso "tili ndi ngongole yambili bwanji" ya China.

translation.en: Dutch Test for New Variant After Finding 61 COVID Cases Among South Africa Passengers
translation.nya: Dutch apeza  odwara nthenda yatsopana ya Variant atamaliza kupeza anthu 61 opezeka ndi COVID mkatikati mwa anthu kwera magalimoto amatora.

translation.en: Dutch health authorities said Saturday they had detected 61 COVID-19 cases among people who flew Friday from South Africa and were now doing further tests to see whether any are infected with the new omicron variant.
translation.nya: Akulu akulu azaumoyo a Dutch Loweluka anena kuti apeza anthu 61 omwe apezeka ndi COVID 19 mkatikati mwa anthu omwe anayenda pa ndege Lachisanu kuchokera ku South Africa ndipo pakali pano akupitilizabe kuyezaku kuti aone ngati alipo wina wakhudzidwa ndi matenda atsopano a Ominicron Variant.

translation.en: The cases were discovered among around 600 passengers who arrived at Amsterdam's Schiphol Airport on two flights Friday before the Dutch government halted air traffic from southern Africa due to concerns over the variant.
translation.nya: Opezeka  ndimatendawa apezeka  pakati pa anthu apaulendo pafup fupi 600omwe anafika pa bwalo landege la Schiphol pa ndige ziwiri zomwe zinafika Lachisanu boma la Dutch lisanaletse ndige zoyenda kuchoka ku mmwera kwa Africa chifukwa cha iwo okhudzidwa ndi Variant.

translation.en: Dutch health authorities said Saturday they also would seek to contact travelers who had arrived from South Africa, Botswana, Eswatini, Lesotho, Mozambique, Namibia and Zimbabwe since Monday and urge them to take a test as soon as possible.
translation.nya: Akulu akulu azaumoyo a Dutch anati Loweluka  anafuna kuti alumikizane ndi  iwo apaulendo omwe anafika kuchokera ku South Africa, Botswana, Eswatini, Lesotho, Mozambique, Namibia, komanso  Zimbabwe kuyambira Lolemba ndipo anawapempha kuti akayezetse mwachangu changu.

translation.en: The passengers from Friday's flights were kept separated from other travelers and those who tested positive are being kept in isolation at a hotel near the airport.
translation.nya: Apaulendo omwe anakwera ndege ya Lachisanu anasungidwa mosiyana ndi athu ena apaulendo omwe anapezeka ndi kachilomboka anasungidwa kwa okha  ku malo ena ogona alendo oyandikana ndi bwalao la ndenge.

translation.en: A spokesperson for the health ministry said it would not be known until later Saturday whether any of passengers are infected with the new variant.
translation.nya: Wapampando wa undunawa zaumoyo  wati kunali kusanadziwike kufikila Loweluka  ngati oyenda paulendowa akhudzidwa ndi mthenda yatsopanoyi ya Variant.

translation.en: A spokesperson for KLM, the Dutch arm of Air France, said the airline was trying to determine what rules were in place as of Friday morning to prevent people with COVID-19 infections from boarding the flights, which departed from Cape Town and Johannesburg.
translation.nya: Wapampando wa KLM, gawo la Dutch loona ndege zaku France , anati owona za ulendo wapa ndege  iwo anayesetsa kufufuza kuti kodi ndondomeko  zanji zomwe zinaikidwa Lachisanu mammawa poteteza anthu kuti asakhudzike ndi COVID 19 Pomwe akukwera ndege, omwe imanyamuka kuchoka ku Cape town  komanso Johannesburg.

translation.en: Rules on the company's website said passengers had to present a negative COVID-19 "rapid antigen" test result taken 24 hours before departure but were not required to show proof of vaccination.
translation.nya: Malamulo patsamba la intaneti la kampani  akuti  anthu apaulendo akuyenera abweletse chitupa choonetsa kuti alibe matenda a COVID 19  chomwe ayezedwa mmaola 24asananyamukekoma sakuyenera kuonetsa chizindikiro chakatemera.

translation.en: Really Weird'  Paula Zimmerman, a Dutch photographer who returned from a family visit in South Africa on Friday morning, said the situation for the passengers on the planes was chaotic, as they were kept waiting on the tarmac and in the terminal for hours.
translation.nya: Zoopsa ndithu' Paula Zimmerman,wojambura zithunzi waku Dutch  yemwe amabwelera kulendo okaona banja lake ku SouthAfrica Lachisanu mammawa,  anati zithu pa anthu apalulendo mundegemo zinali zosokonekera, pomwe anasungidwa pa tala pamalo pokwelera  kwa maola.

translation.en: Zimmerman was told she had tested negative at 4 a.m., almost 18 hours after landing in Amsterdam, but said she then found out she was standing right next to a man who knew he had tested positive for an infection.
translation.nya: Zimmerman sanapezeke ndi matenda nthawi ya 4 koloko mammawa, pafupifupi maola 18 chifikileni pa Amsterdam,  koma akuti anazindikira kuti anaima pafupi ndi muthu yemwe amadziwa kuti iyeyo wapezeka kuti ndiokhudziwa ndi matendawo.

translation.en: "It was really weird.
translation.nya: Zinali zoopsa.

translation.en: There was no coordination.
translation.nya: Panalibe kulumikizana.

translation.en: There were too few people and there really wasnt anybody who took control."  Having spent hours on a flight that likely had many infected passengers made Zimmerman anxious for the days to come, she said.  "Ive been told that they expect that a lot more people will test positive after five days.
translation.nya: Panali anthu  ochepa kwambiri  ndipo panalibe aliyense amathandiza. Kukhala maora ochuluka mundege makamaka momwe anthu ochuluka omwe anthu apaulendo ochuluka omwe anakhudzika ndi matendawa ninamupangitsa Zammerman kukhara ndinkhawa kwa masiku akutsogolo, anatero. Ndauzidwa kuti anthu ochuluka akuyembekezera kupezeka okhuzika ndimatendawa masiku asanu akubwerawa

translation.en: It's a little scary the idea that you've been in a plane with a lot of people who tested positive."
translation.nya: Ndizoopserapo kuganiza kuti unakwera ndege ndi anthu ochuluka omwe anapezeka ndimatendawa.

translation.en: The Dutch flight ban does not mean that all flights from southern Africa to the Netherlands are halted, as Dutch citizens are allowed to return home, while EU citizens are allowed entry in transit to their home countries.
translation.nya: Kuimitsidwa kwa ndege za Dutch sizikutanthawuza kuti ndege zonse zaku mwera kwa Africa kupita ku Netherlands zaimitsidwa. Ngati mbadwa za Dutch ndiololedwa kubwelera kwa, pamene  mbadwa za E.U  akuloledwa kulowa podutsira kupita ku dziko lakwawo.

translation.en: Medical staff, airline crews and people with pressing needs are also still allowed to travel. KLM will continue flights to the region, but travelers need to stay in quarantine for at least five days upon arrival in the Netherlands.
translation.nya: Ogwira ntchito zachipatara, ogwira ntchito kampani ya ndege komanso anthu omwe ali ndizithu zawo nawo akuloledwabe kuyenda. KLM apitiliza kuyenda mzigawo, koma iwo apaulend akuyenerabe kukhara kumalo kusongirako anth kwamasiku asanu kuchokera tsiku lomwe afika ku Netherland.

translation.en: The new variant has been detected just as many European countries are grappling with a surge in coronavirus cases.
translation.nya: Maonekedwe atsopano a kachilomboka kapezedwa momwe mayiko ambili a ku ulaya(Europe) akuvutika ndi kukula kwa chiwerengero cha anthu opezeka ndi kachilombo ka corona

translation.en: The Dutch government on Friday announced the nighttime closure of bars, restaurants and most stores as it tries to curb a record-breaking wave of COVID-19 cases that is swamping its health care system.
translation.nya: Boma la  Dutch Lachisanu lalengeza nthawi yamadzulo yotsekera malo omwera mowa, malo odyera zakudya ndimalo ena ogulitsira zinthu pomwe akuyesetsa kuti athetse  mbiri yoopsa ya omwe apezeka ndi mlili wa COVID 19 yomwe yaononga njira zawo zaumoyo

translation.en: EU to Suspend Travel From Southern Africa Over New COVID Variant
translation.nya: EU yaimitsa maulendo ochokeraku dziko la South Africa chifukwa cha maonekedwe a tsopano a COVID

translation.en: European Union states have agreed to suspend travel from southern Africa after the detection of a new COVID-19 variant, the presidency of the EU said Friday.
translation.nya: Mayiko a mgwirizano wa mayiko a ku ulaya wotchedwa EU agwilizana kuti ayimitse maulendo ochokera kumwera kwa Africa chifukwa chakupezeka kwa maonekedwe atsopano a COVID 19, utsogoleri wa EU unanena lachisanu

translation.en: A committee of health experts from all 27 EU states "agreed on the need to activate the emergency break & impose temporary restriction on all travel into EU from southern Africa," the Slovenian presidency of the EU said on Twitter.   Restrictions will apply to Botswana, Eswatini, Lesotho, Mozambique, Namibia, South Africa and Zimbabwe, European Commission spokesperson Eric Mamer said on Twitter.
translation.nya: Gulu la akadauro a zaumoyo kuchokera ku mayiko onse 27 omwe ali mu EU "anagwilizana zakufunikira kwakuika kuima kwadzidzidziku ndikukakamiza ziletso zakanthawi pa maulendo a ochokera ku mwera kwa Africa kupita ku EU.," mtsogoleri wa EU anatero pa tsamba la mchezo la pa intaneti la Twitter,. Malirewa agwira ntchito kwa mayiko a Botswana, Eswatini, Lesotho, Mozambique, Namibia, South Africa and Zimbabwe, oyankhulira bungwe la European Commission a Eric Mamer anatero pa tsamba la mchezo la Twitter.

translation.en: An EU official said that EU governments have also been asked to discourage travel to those countries.
translation.nya: Ogwira ntchito ku EU anatero kuti ulamuliro wa EU walimbikitsa kuletsa maulendo opita ku mayiko amenewa

translation.en: Each of the 27 EU countries is free to apply the new measures when it prefers. Some are already applying restrictions.
translation.nya: Dziko lililonse mu mayiko 27  a mu EU ndilomasuka kutsata njira zatsopanozi pamene lakonda kutero. Ena ayamba kale kugwiritsa ntchito zilestozi

translation.en: EU officials said that no decision had yet been made on other countries in other parts of the world where cases were detected, which include Hong Kong, Israel and Belgium, an EU country.
translation.nya: Anthu ogwira ntchito ku EU anena kuti palibe chiganizo chomwe chapangidwa pa mayiko ena muzigawo zina za dziko lapansi komwe kachilombo katsopanoka sikanaonekere, omwe ndi mayiko a Hong Kong, Israel, ndi Belgium dziko la mu EU

translation.en: Global alarm
translation.nya: Kudzidzimuka kwa dziko lonse la pansi

translation.en: The new coronavirus variant, first detected in South Africa, has caused global alarm as researchers seek to find out if it is vaccine-resistant.
translation.nya: Maonekedwe a tsopano a kachilombo ka Corona kamene kanapezedwa koyambilira ku dziko la South Africa kanabweretsa mantha pa dziko lonse lapansi pamene akafukufuku akuyang'ana kuti apeze ngati sikangagonje ku katemera.

translation.en: Marc Van Ranst, the virologist who detected the new variant in Belgium, told Reuters it was more likely the infected woman had contracted the variant in Belgium rather than while traveling outside Europe.
translation.nya: Marc Van Ranst, kadaulo pankhani ya tizilombo amene anazindikira maonekedwe atsopanowa ku Belgium anauza Reuters kuti kunali kotheka kwambili kuti mzimayi yemwe anapezeka ndi kachilomboka anakatenga ku dziko la Belgium osati pa ulendo wa kunja kwa Europe.

translation.en: She had been in Egypt earlier in November but developed symptoms only 11 days after her return to Belgium. She is not vaccinated.
translation.nya: Anali atapitako ku Egypt kumayambiliro mu November koma zizindikiro zinayamba kuoneka patatha masiku 11 atabwerako ku Belgium.Iye ndiosabayidwa katemera

translation.en: Switzerland imposed on Friday a requirement of 10-day quarantine and a negative test for travelers from Belgium, Israel and Hong Kong, in addition to travel bans on southern African countries.
translation.nya: Dziko la Swirtzerland lalamulalachisanu kufunikira kwakusunga anthu kwawokha komanso kuti aulendo ochokera ku Belgium, Israel, ndi Hong Kong azipezeka opanda kachilomboka pamwamba pa kuimitsa kwa maulendo a ku mwera kwa Africa

translation.en: Italy Imposes Entry Ban on Eight Southern African States
translation.nya: Dziko la Italy lakamiza chiletso chakulowa pa mayiko 8 a kumwera kwa Africa

translation.en: Italy imposed an entry ban Friday on people who have visited any one of eight southern African states in the last 14 days, because of the spread of a new COVID-19 variant there.
translation.nya: Dziko la Italy laletsa mokakamiza anthu omwe anayenderako dziko limodzi lililonse mwa mayiko 8 aku mwera kwa Africa mmasiku 14 apitawo, chifukwa cha kufalikira kwa kachilombo ka maonekedwe atsopano ka COVID 19 ku mayikowa

translation.en: Italian Health Minister Roberto Speranza signed an executive order banning entry of travelers from South Africa, Lesotho, Botswana, Malawi, Zimbabwe, Mozambique, Namibia and Eswatini.
translation.nya: Nduna ya umoyo ku Italy a Roberto Speranza anavomereza lamulo loletsa kulowa kwa oyenda ochokera ku mayiko a South Africa, Lesotho, Botswana, Malawi, Zimbabwe, Mocambique, Namibia ndi Eswatini.

translation.en: "Our scientists are studying the new B.1.1.529 variant. In the meantime, we will adopt the greatest possible caution," Speranza said.
translation.nya: " Akadaulo a sayansi athu akufufuza maonekedwe a tsopano a B.1.1.529. Pakadali pano, tichita njira ina iliyonse yabwino kuti tipewe," anatero Sperenza.

translation.en: Zimbabwe Environmentalists Demand More Than Rhetoric on Climate Change
translation.nya: Owona zanyengo ku zimbabwe akufana zithu zapamwamba kwambiri zokhudza kusintha kwa nyengo.

translation.en: Environmentalists in Zimbabwe are reacting angrily to President Emmerson Mnangagwa's address at the COP26 conference, where he pledged his government's fight against deforestation and climate change. Environmentalists say the government is busy dishing out land to companies, mainly Chinese, to mine coal for energy use, which COP26 wants phased out.
translation.nya: Azanyengo akuzimbabwe aonetsa kukwiya kwa Mtsogoleli wadziko  Emmerson Mnangagwa pakuyankhura kwake  pamkumano wa COP26, pomwe anapempha boma lake kulimbana ndi kaduludwe kamitengo kosasamala ndikusintha kwa nyengo. Owona zanyengo anati boma lilipakalikiliki  opeleka malo kuma  kampani, kwambiri ma china, kwa opanga mphamvu zamagetsi kuchokera kumiyara, zomwe a COPE 26 amafuna kuzithetsa.

translation.en: Tuesday in Scotland, President Emmerson Mnangagwa addressed the 2021 United Nations Climate Change Conference, known as COP26, where he urged developed countries to pay for causing global warming by emitting gases into the atmosphere.
translation.nya: Lachiwiri ku Scotland, Mtsogoleli Emmerso Mnangagwa anayankhura pa nsonkhano wa maiko  wazakusintha kwa nyengo wa 2021,kudziwika ngati COP26, komwe anapepmpha maiko olemera kuti alipile chifukwa chowononga mpweya wamulengalenga pakuchotsa mpweya  mulengalenga.

translation.en: He said developing nations like Zimbabwe were paying for the consequences of those emissions.
translation.nya: Anati maiko ovutika ngati Zimbabwe  amalipira pazotsatirazi zakuonongeka kwa mpweyako.

translation.en: He also pledged his countrys cooperation in the fight against climate change.
translation.nya: Anapemphanso dziko lake kuti agwilizane polimbana nikusintha kwa nyengo.

translation.en: "Zimbabwe has revised its nationally determined contributions, a committed conditional 40% per capita greenhouse gas emissions reduction target by 2030. Comprehensive strategies are being implemented towards mainstreaming climate change adaptation and resilience across all sectors of our economy," Mnangagwa said.
translation.nya: Zimbabwe yaunikanso momwe dziko lawo lifunile kuthanizira,  njira lodzipeleka ndi 40%  pa malo aliwonse ochepetsera kuochotsedwa kwa mpweya mulengalenga kulunjika ku 2030. njira zapamwamba zakhazikitsidwa pakulunjika cholingachathu chachikulu  pakusintha kwa nyengo  ndikuzolowera komanso kukhazikitsa bata mu zigawo zathu zonse za zachuma, " anatero  Mnangagwa.

translation.en: This comes at a time when environmentalists in Zimbabwe are asking the government to revoke an exploration license recently awarded to a Chinese company to mine coal for energy use.
translation.nya: Izi zimabwera panthawi yomwe owona zanyengo ku zimbabwe anapempha boma kuti Lerande chitupa chachilolezo chomwe chinapelekedwa posachedwapa ku kampani yama china  kuti azikumba miyara yantengo wapatari kuti azigwilitsa ntchito pa mpamvu zamagetsi.

translation.en: The Center for Natural Resource Governance is one of the organizations opposing the license. The group promotes green energy, and fears that exploration for coal will cause greater deforestation.
translation.nya: Bungwe la Center for Naturural Resource Governance nsi bungwe limodzi lomwe limatsutsana ndi chitupachi. Gululi limalimbikitsa mpamvu za chilengedwe, ndipo amaopa kuti kukumbidwa kwa miyarayi kudzapangitsa kuonongeka kwachilengedwe kwambiri.

translation.en: Henry Nyapokoto, the program manager for the group, said Mnangagwas comments run contrary to what he sees going on.
translation.nya: Henry Nyapokoto wamkulu oyang'anira madongosolo a gululi,  anati ndemanga ya Mnangagwa  ikukamba zosiyana ndizomwe iyi waona zikuchitika.

translation.en: "But the government has been in overdrive mode to promote mining everywhere in order to reach the $12 billion mining economy. In fact, it wont (make) ecological sense for Zimbabwe to attain a $12 billion economy based on bad models of production, bad consumption, that leaves a huge ecological footprint or a legacy of an ecological disaster. We all understand that mining comes with destruction of forests that serves as carbon sinks and habitat for wildlife," Nyapokoto said.
translation.nya: Koma bomalakhala patsogolo kuyendetsa ndikulimbikitsa kukumba miyara paliponse pofuna kukwaniritsa chuma chakumiyara chokwana $12  billion. Koma  kunena zoona izi  sizingatheke Zimbabwe kupeza chuma chokwana $12 billion kudalira njiora zoipa zopangira katundu,  kagwilitsidwe kolakwika,zimenezi zisiya chilema chachikulu ku zachilengedwe kape  mbilri yakuonongeka kwa zachilengedwe. Tonse timadziwa kuti kukumba miyara yamtengo wapatali kumabwera ndikuononga kwa nkhalango yomwe imachotsa mpweya oipa  komanso malo akhara zinyama zakutchire., " anatero Nyapokoto.

translation.en: Nyapokoto added that Zimbabwe was exploring oil and gas on its northeast border with Zambia, another project that could lead to deforestation.
translation.nya: Nyapokoto anaonjezera kuti Zimbabwe imatulutsa mafuta  komanso mpweya kuchipata chake chuku mpoto ndi Zambiya, Zochitika zina zomwe zikanapangitsa kuonongeka kwa chilengedwe.

translation.en: "Despite the impact of oil and gas on global warming, there will be (a) visible, immediate direct effect of this oil and gas mining on local communities or ecosystems. Land will be cleared for mining and other infrastructure that is going to support that mining. That is contrary to the greening of the economy that they are talking about in Glasgow," Nyapokoto said.
translation.nya: Kupatura kukhudzika kwa mafuta  komanso mpweya  kwa kuonongeka kwa mpweya wa mulengalenga, pakhala voto loonekera pompano lolunjika mafutawa komanso kukumba mpweya  kumamidzi kapena ku zachilengedwe. Malo alambulidwa chifukwa cha kukumba miyara komanso kumanga zinthu zina zomwe zithandizile kukumba miyara. Izo ndizosemphana ndikukonza zachuma zomwe iwo amakamba ku Glasgow'" Anatero Nyapotoko.

translation.en: He said Zimbabwe was in the top 10 of countries of deforestation, with about 300,000 hectares of forests destroyed annually.
translation.nya: Anati Zimbabwe ili mu ndandanda wa maiko 10 akuononga chilengedwe. Ndi pafupifupi 300,000 ekara ya nkhalango  zimaonongedwa pachaka.

translation.en: But Byron Zamasiya of the Zimbabwe Environmental Law Association says Mnangagwa was genuine in his COP26 address about fighting deforestation caused by need for energy.
translation.nya: Koma Byron Zamasiya wa bungwe la Zimbabwe Enviromental Law Association anati Mnangagwa  ananena zoona  mukulankhura kwaku ku COP26 zakulimbana ndikuononga chilengedwe komwe akupangitsa iwo ofuna Mphavu.

translation.en: "So, the issue of fighting deforestation is a key ingredient for addressing greenhouse gas emissions for Zimbabwe. The trees act as a carbon sink since they absorb carbon dioxide, which is a major cause of global warming. What we may want as a country is to make available alternative sources of energy, especially for the rural communities who rely on wood fuel and account for the major part of deforestation. We may also need to promote intensive farming methods as opposed to extensive farming methods that require bigger fields and the clearing of new forests for fields," Zamasiya said.
translation.nya: Ndiye nkhani yolimbana ndi kuononga chilengedwe ndyofunikira kumaikamo pamene pakuyankhulidwa za malo achilengedweochotsa mpweya oipa mulengalenga ku zimbabwe. Mitengo imagwira ntchito yoyamwa mpweya ndipoimayamwa mpweya owonongeka, omwe ndioyambitsa kwambiri kuonongeka kwa mpweya wamulengalenga. Chomwe tingafune ngati dziko ndikupeza njira ina yopezera mpamvu, makamaka kumamidzi komwe amadalira mkhuni ndipo zimaonjezre gawo lalikulu ku kuononga chilengedwe. tikuyeneranso kulimbikitsa maulimi ang'ono ang'ono omwe amasiyanda ndi ulumi akulu akulu omwe amafuna mindi yaukulu ndikulambula maro ankhalando akulu kuti pakhale minda, Anatero Zamasiya.

translation.en: The Environmental Management Agency in Zimbabwe has been fining people caught cutting or burning forests. But so far, that hasnt stopped the trees from coming down.
translation.nya: Bungwe la Enviromental Management Agency ku Zimbabwe lakhala likulipilitsa chindapusa anthu omwe amagwidwa akudura komanso kuyatsa nkhalango.  Koma pakanali pano izi sizinaimitse kuduliwa kwa mitengo.

translation.en: Zimbabwe Starts Vaccinating Teens Against COVID-19
translation.nya: Zimbabwe yayamba katemera wa ana achisodera.

translation.en: President Emmerson Mnangagwa's government has announced it is starting to vaccinate Zimbabwes teenagers over the age of 16 against COVID-19, which has claimed nearly 5,000 lives and infected 13,000 in the country. Public health experts welcome the move.
translation.nya: Boma la mtsongoleri Emmerson Mnangagwa lalengeza kuti likuyambakatemera wa ana achisodzera aku zimbabwe opyola zaka  16 polimbana ndi COVI19, yemwe watenga miyoyo pafupifupi 5,000 ndikukhudza anthu 13,000 mudziko, akatswiri owona zachipatara agwilizana nayo ndondomekoyi.

translation.en: Zimbabwes acting Health and Child Care Minister Amon Murwira told journalists late Monday that the country had so far managed to vaccinate 38% of the population.
translation.nya: Wapampando ogwirizira zaumoyo komanso chisamaliro cha ana ku zimbabwe  Amon Murwira anauza mtola nkhani Lolemba lapitali kuti pakadali pano dziko lakwani kupeleka katemera 38%  pachikgawo cha anthu.

translation.en: He then announced the recommendation regarding those over the age of 16.
translation.nya: Ndipo iye analengeza zoyenelera ktuengera iwo opyora zaka 16.

translation.en: "Based on the available scientific data in line with the Medicines Control Authority of Zimbabwe guide, the specialist pediatricians have recommended a vaccination of the 16 to 17 years age group with the Sinovac COVID19 vaccine," said Murwira.
translation.nya: Motengera ndi kaundunra wa azachipatara molingana ndi a Medecines Control Authority of Zimbabwe  guide, katswiri owona zachipatara makamaka ku ana anavomeleza kulandira katemera kwa gulu lazaka 16 mpaka 17 ndi katemera wa  sinovac COVID 19, " Anatero  Murwira.

translation.en: "The protocol of the younger age groups is still under consideration. The ministry wishes to advise the public that COVID19 vaccination of the 16 to 17 years age groups has been approved. The government of Zimbabwe through the Ministry of Health and Childcare is determined that Zimbabwe achieves herd immunity by end December 2021," he added.
translation.nya: Dongosolo la gulu la ana azaka zachichepeleri linakaunikilidwabe. Unduna wafuna udziwitse anthu za katemera wa COVID19  yemwe akupelekedwa kwa  gulu la anthu azaka 16 mpaka 17 anavomelezedwa. Boma la dziko Zimbabwe kudzera  ku unduna wa zachipatala komanso chisamaliro cha ana ukuonetsetsa kuti Zimbabwe ikwaniritse kufikira aliyense ndikatemera pofika kumamaliziro a mwezi wa december  2021, " Iye anaonjezera.

translation.en: Dr. Norman Matara, the head of Zimbabwe Association for Doctors for Human Rights, is hopeful the move would increase the number of people getting vaccinated and will push the country further to achieving head immunity.
translation.nya: Dr, Norman Marata mkulu wa  Zimbabwe Association fro Doctor for Human Rights,  ali ndichiyembekezo kuti dongosolori lichilutsa numbala ya anthu omwe abayitse katemera ndipo zithandizira kuti dziko lipite patsogolo kukwanitsa cholinga chopeleka katemera kwa aliyense.

translation.en: "This is a welcome move, but we just hope that the vaccine will continue to be voluntary and that these teenagers will not be mandated to get vaccines in schools and colleges. But people should just continue to voluntarily get the vaccines," he said.
translation.nya: Iyi ndi njira yabwino,  koma tikukhulipilira kuti katemerayu apitilira kukhara waulele ndipo ana achisodzerawa sakakamizidwa kulandira katemera ku sukulu komanso ku sukulu zaukachenjede. Koma anthu apitilira kulandira katemera mwaufulu, " Iye anatero.

translation.en: Itai Rusike, head of nonprofit Community Working Group on Health in Zimbabwe, commended the government for the announcement as it helps the country reach its target of vaccinating at least 10 million Zimbabweans — or 60% of the population — by the end of the year.
translation.nya: Itai Rusike, mkuli  wa bungwe longothandiza la  Community Working Group on Health in Zimbabwe, anayamikira boma polengeza  zomwe zatahndiza dziko kufikira mulingo wake opeleka katemera kwa anthu akuzimbabwe mafupifupi 10 miliyoni kapena kuti 60% ya anthu  pakutha kwa chaka.

translation.en: "This is important in order to prevent the teenagers from COVID-19 infections, hospitalizations and even death, especially from the looming threat of the new delta variant. It is also important that the school health coordinators are equipped with the necessary COVID-19 vaccine literacy so that they can then assist in educating the students, the teachers and support staff on the importance of getting vaccinated. It is also important that the community leaders should play a critical role in being our COVID-19 champions and ambassadors so that they can encourage the parents and the children within their communities to embrace the vaccines," said Rusike.
translation.nya: Izi ndizofunikira pofuna kuteteza  ana achisodzera ku kukhudzidwa ndi COVID 19 , kugonekedwa muchipatala ngakhale kuimfa, makamaka  posapeleka mpata melili oopsa wa delta variant.  Ndichinthu chofunikiranso kuti azaumoyo oyang'anira mma sukulu adzazidwa bwino ndimaphunziro ofunikira  a katemera wa COVID 19 kuti atha kuthandizira kuphunzitsa ana asukulu, aphunzitsi  ndi ena othandizira pa kufunikira kolandira katemera. ndizofunikilanso kuti atsogoleli amaderakuti khale akatstwiri otenga gawo lovutitsitsa pa COVID19 ndikukharanso oimilira kuti atha kulimbikitsa makolo ndi ana mmadera mwawo polandira katemera, " Anatero Rusike.

translation.en: Zimbabwe has fully inoculated just above 2.6 million people since February when it began its vaccination program to contain the COVID-19 pandemic.
translation.nya: Zimbabwe yapeleka katemera yense kw anthu oposera 2.6 miliyoni kuchokera feburuary pomwe anayamba dongosolo yothana ndi mulili wa COVID-19.

translation.en: Zimbabwe President Mnangagwa to Attend COP26 Conference
translation.nya: Mtsogoleli wadziko la Zimbabwe  akakhaka nawo pa msokhano wa COP26

translation.en: Zimbabwe President Emmerson Mnangagwa says he will attend COP26, becoming the first Zimbabwe leader to visit the United Kingdom since Zimbabwe was accused of human rights abuses and election rigging. Mnangagwa also said a U.N. rapporteur had proved his government was right about the sanctions issue.
translation.nya: Mtsogoleli w dziko la zimbabwe Emmeron Mnangagwa  wati akapezeka ku COP26,   akhala mtsogoleli oyamba wa zdiko la Zimbabwe kuyendera dziko la United Kingdom kuchokera nthawi yomwe Zimbabwe inatsutsa  nkhani zophwanya  ufulu wa anthu komanso kubela kwa zisankho, MNngagwa anatinso  U.N rapporteur  kuti boma lake  linapanga zoyenera zokhudza mulandu wazisankho.

translation.en: Winding up an annual conference of the ruling ZANU-PF party Saturday in Bindura, 80 kilometers north of Zimbabwes capital, Mnangagwa said he was looking forward to attending the 2021 United Nations Climate Change Conference, known as COP26, in Scotland, which begins Sunday.
translation.nya: Pomalizitsa msonkhano wa pachaka wa chipani cholamula cha ZANU-PF Loweluka ku Bindura, mtonda otalika 80 kilomitazi  kumpoto kwa zinda waukulu wa Zimbabwe, Mnangagwa anati akuyembekezeranso kudzakhala nawo pamsonkhano mu chaka cha 2021 United Climate  Change Conference, omwe umadziwika kuti COP26, ku Scotland, omwe ukuyamba Lamulungu.

translation.en: "I wish to inform the conference that tomorrow morning (Sunday) I travel to Glasgow, United Kingdom, after over two decades have passed without Zimbabwe leadership going to United Kingdom. I have been invited by [British Prime Minister] Boris Johnson, and [he] has indicated he might meet me; one on one, as well as other leaders like India prime minister and others, we are meeting them," he said.
translation.nya: "Ndimfuna ndizdiwitse pamkumanowu kuti mawa mammawa(Lmulungu) ndikupita ku Glasgow, United Kingdom, patantha  ndikudutsa zaka zoposera makumi awiri Utsogoleri wa Zimbabwe osapita ku United Kingdom. Ndaitanidwa ndi Nduna yaku Boris Johnson ndipo wauonetsa kuti titha kakumana maso ndi maso, chimodzi modzinso azitsogolieri ena ngati nduna yaku India andi enanso, tikukuman nawo, Anatero.

translation.en: Mnangagwa also said he was happy about a report by U.N. Special Rapporteur Alena Douhan after a two-week visit to Zimbabwe. The Belarus national urged the U.S. and other Western governments to lift sanctions they imposed on Zimbabwe nearly two decades ago and for alleged election-rigging and human rights abuses.
translation.nya: Mnangagw anatinso anali okondwa  ndizomwe anayankhura a U.N. Special Rapporteur Alena Douhanatakayendera dziko la Zimbabwe kwa masabata awiri. Dziko la Belarus yapepha  U.S  ndi maiko ena azungu kuti achotse chilango chomwe anane kwa Zimbabwe  pafupifipi dzaka makumi awiri zapitazo pakubera zisankho komanso kuphwanya maufulu a anthu.

translation.en: "We as government, we as ZANU-PF, have been vindicated by the report released by the United Nations special rapporteur. We should congratulate ourselves. We have never been wrong, and we shall continue always being right. Those who have been found outside the law should reckon their position," Mnangagwa said.
translation.nya: Ife ngati boma, Ife ngati ZANU-PF,  tinakutira ndi zomwe anapeza ndikutulutsa akatswiri a atolankhani a United Nations, tikuyenera kuziyamikira tokha. Sitinalakwitsepo, ndipo tizapitiliza kukhara ochita zolondolra. Iowo omwe apezeka akuphwanja lamulo akuyenera atule pansi maudindo awo, ' anatero Mnangagwa.

translation.en: But in an audio statement released by the U.S. Embassy in Harare, U.S. Ambassador to the United Nations Linda Thomas-Greenfield said sanctions on Zimbabwes leadership were not hurting ordinary citizens.
translation.nya: Koma mau otepedwa omwe anatulutsidwa  ku nyumba youanganira mbadzwa zaku U.S ku Harare, Kazembe wa U.S ku United Nation Linda Thomas Greenfield anati chilango cha atsogoleri aku Zimbabwe   sichimapweteka  mbadwa zawamba.

translation.en: "Our sanctions target individuals and institutions that are committing human rights violations. And we make every effort to ensure those sanctions do not impact the people. What is happening in Zimbabwe is a result of bad policies in Zimbabwe. What is happening in Zimbabwe is a consequence of their leadership. It is not a consequence of our sanctions, and we will always resist any criticism that says our sanctions are impacting people unfairly. We are criticized by the government [of Zimbabwe] for these actions because they know they are responsible for these actions. I regret that the special rapporteur decided to put this in [her] report," Thomas-Greenfield said.
translation.nya: Chilango chathu chikulundika pa munthu komanso mabungwe omwe  anapalamula mulandu ophwanya ufulu wa anthu. Ndipo tikuyesetsa mbali ina iliyonse kuti chilango ichi chisakhudze anthu. Zomwe zikuchitika ku Zimbabwe ndizotsatira za mfundo zoipa zomwezinakhazikitsidwa ku zimbabwe.Zomwe zikuchitika ku Zimbabwe nsizotsatira zautsogoleri wawo. Sizotsatira zachilango chathu, ndipo tizapitiliza kukana kutsutsidwa kwina kulikonse kuti chilango chanthu chikuikidwa pa anthu mosayenera. Izi timatsutsidwa nazo ndi boma la Zimbabwe chifukwa amadziwa kuti vuto ndi iwowo pa zimenezi. Ndi zokhudza kuti mtolankhani wa paderedera anasankha kuyika izi mu uthenga wake womwe analemba," anatero Thoams Greenfield.

translation.en: The European Union imposed travel and financial sanctions on then-Zimbabwean president Robert Mugabe and his allies in 2002, in response to reports of election-rigging and human rights. The U.S. followed suit with sanctions in 2003.
translation.nya: Bungwe la European Union  anaika mokakamiza ziletso za mayendedwe ndi chuma pa mtsogoleri wa dziko la Zimbabwe wa nthawi imeneyo, a Robert Mugabe ndi ogwirizana nawo mu chaka cha 2002 potsatana ndi kubeledwa kwa zisankho komanso ma ufulu wa obadwa nawo. Mgwilizano wa mayikp pthedwa U.S onachita chimodzimodzi mu chaka cha 2003.

translation.en: Earlier this week, in separate statements, the U.S., Britain and the European Union said Zimbabwes economy was suffering, not because of sanctions but because of corruption and government mismanagement of the countrys resources.
translation.nya: Kumayambiliro a sabata ino, mgwilizano wa mayiko wa U.S, Britain komanso bungwe la European Union mu mauthenga osiyana anati chumacha dziko la Zimbabwe chimavutika osati chifukwa cha ziletsozo koma chifukwa cha ziphuphu komanso kukanika kugwiritsa ntchito chuma cha dzikolo ndi boma.

translation.en: Zimbabwean Liberation War Vets Released After Protesting Low Pensions
translation.nya: Asilikali akale omwe anamenya nawo nkhondo ya Zimbabwean Liberation War amasulidwa atatha kupanga zionetsero pa kuchepa kwa ndalama za peshoni

translation.en: A court in Zimbabwe Friday ordered the release of about 40 veterans of the nations 1970s independence war, four days after they tried to petition President Emmerson Mnangagwa about their low monthly pension.
translation.nya: Bwalo la milandu ku Zimbabwe la chisanu linalamula kumasulidwa kwa asilikali akale okwana pafupifupi 40 omwe anamenya nawo nkhondo yomenyera ufuluodziimira pa okha mu chaka cha 1970, patatha masiku anayi akuyesera kupeleka madando awo kwa mtosgoleriwa dzikolo Emmerson Mnangagwa pa nkhani yokhudzana ndi kuchepa kwa ndalama za peshoni.

translation.en: Their lawyers accuse the government of infringing on citizens right to demonstrate, particularly those who opposed President Mnangagwas rule.
translation.nya: Owayimilira pa mlandu pa mlanduwu ananeneza boma pa mlandu wapondereza ufulu wa mzika zadzikolo wa kuchita zionetsero, makamaka iwo omwe anatsutsana ndi lamulo la mtsogoleri wa dziko Mnangagwa.

translation.en: War veterans chatted outside the courtroom Friday after Magistrate Barbra Mateko ordered their release on about $40 bail. They were arrested Monday while trying to go to Mnangagwas office to ask for a review of their less than $100 monthly pension.
translation.nya: Nkhalakale zpa nkhondozi anacheza panja pa bwalo la milandu la chisanu pamene oweruza otchedwa magistrate Babra Mateko analamula kumasulidwa atapeleka ndalama za chikole choyendera milandu cha $40. Iwo anamangidwa lolemba pamene amaeyesera kupita ku mao ogwilira ntchito a Mnangagwa kukafunsa ngati angakonze  pa ndalama yosakwana $100 pa mwezi a peshoni

translation.en: Paidamoyo Saurombe, from Zimbabwe Lawyers for Human Rights, spoke to VOA after he secured the war veterans release on bail.
translation.nya: Paidamoyo Saurombe wochokera ku bungwe lo oimilira milandu la Zimbabwe Lawyers for Human Rights anayankhura ndI VOA atawapezetsa a nkhalakale pa nkhondowa kumasulidwa koyendera mlandu.

translation.en: "Its not a crime to demonstrate in Zimbabwe, its not a crime to petition. Its actually provided for by the constitution," Saurombe said. "So in anything that has to be done, it has to be done in those ambits of the constitution or in those constitutional provisions. And our clients were following constitutional provisions, so to say they committed a crime it would rather be absurd."
translation.nya: "Kupanga zionetsero ku Zimbabwe si mlandu, simlandu kupeleka madando. Makamakanso malamulo aakulu mdzikoamalora kutero," anatero Saurombe."Tsono pa chilichonse chomwe chingachitike zikuyenera kukhala mu malire oyikidwa ndi lamulo lalikululi(constitution) kapena zomwe zili zololedwa ndi lamuloli. Komanso omwe tikuwaimilira amatsatira zomwe lamulo la dziko limaloleza, choncho kunena kuti anapalamura mlandu zitha kukhala zosamveka.

translation.en: The veterans are expected to go on trial next month. The offense of "breaching the peace," which they face, has an option of a fine if they are convicted.
translation.nya: Nkhalakalezi zikuyembekezeka kukaonekera ku bwalo la milandu kukayankha mlandu mwezi wa mawa. Malndu wa "kusokoneza mtendere ," womwe akuyankha aloi ndi mwayi opeleka choindapusa akapezeka olakwa pa mladuwu.

translation.en: Addressing senior members of the ruling ZANU-PF party Friday in Bindura, about 80 kilometers north of Harare, President Mnangagwa said the war veterans had broken protocol.
translation.nya: Powayankhura akuluakulu a chipani cholamura cha ZANU-PF lachisanu ku Bindura, pafupifupi ma kilomita 80 ku mpoto kwa Harare, Mtsogoleri wa dziko Mnangagwa anati nkhalakale za nkhondozi sanatsate dongososlo loyenera.

translation.en: "Various initiatives have been implemented to improve the dignity, welfare and economic empowerment of veterans of the liberation struggle and dependence of the heroes," Mnangagwa said. "But I urge the war veterans to use procedures in the party, not outside the party.Their rich ideological grounding should galvanize the principle of patriotism in the hearts and minds of cadres and embolden them in their efforts to ensure that ZANU-PF remains the party of choice which wholeheartedly serves the people."
translation.nya: Bntchito zosiyanasiyana zakhazikitsidwa pofuna kupititsa patsogolo ulemu, chisamaliro komanso kuchita bwino pa chuma cha a nkhalakalewa pa mavuto aku masulidwa komanso podalira kwa ngwazizi," Mnangagwa anatero. "Koma ndikulimbikitsa nkhalakalezi kugwilitsa ndondomeko zoyenera mu chipanichi,osati panja pa chipanichi. Mfundo zawo zozama zithandizire kumangilira mfundo ya kukonda dziko lawo mu mitma ndi malingaliro awo ndikuwalemba mukuyesetsa kuti chipani cha ZANU-PF chipitilire kukhala chipani chosankhika chomwe chimatumikira anthu ake ndi mtima wonse

translation.en: At the court, one of the war veterans, who identified himself as Cde Tendai, said he was relieved his colleagues had been granted bail because some of them have chronic conditions.
translation.nya: Ku bwalo la milandu,mmodzi mwa ankhalakalewa yemwe anazitchura Cde Tendai,anati iye mtima wake unatsika pansi atamva kuti amzake atulutsidwa pa belo chifukwa ena mwa iwo ali ndi matenda akabwerebwere

translation.en: "We were concerned by their health," Tendai said. "We feared that some of them may have died because most war veterans are stressed by so many things. We were surprised by their arrests. We were not violent, we respect the rule of law and our government. The only issue was: we want to petition since we are getting very little money considering how life is difficult."
translation.nya: "Timakhudzika chifukwa cha thanzi lawo," anatero Tendai. "Tinali ndimantha kuti ena athakumwalira poti ankhalekale ambili ali ndi ziphinjo zambili. Tinadabwandi kumangidwa kwawo . Sitinapange ziwawa zilizonse, tiamalemekeza lamulo komanso boma lathu. Vuto lomwelinalipo ndi lakut: timafuna kusiya madando athu pakuti timalandira ndalama yochepa kutengera ndi momwe moyo wavutira."

translation.en: Zimbabwes war of liberation from the white minority-led rule of Ian Smith lasted for 16 years, from 1964 to 1980.The government still pays monthly pensions to about 30,000 veterans of the war.
translation.nya: Nkhondo yomenyerera kumasulidwa kwa Zimbabwe kuchoka ku ulamuliro wa azungu wa Ian Smith inatenga zaka 16, kuchokera chaka cha 1964 mpaka chaka cha 1980. Boma limapeleka ndalama za opuma pa ntchito kwa ankhalakale pa nkhondo okwanira pafupifupi 30,000.

translation.en: Zimbabwe Government: No COVID-19 Shot, No Work, No Pay
translation.nya: Boma la Zimbabwe: Osabayitsa katemera wa Covid, osagwira ntchito, osalandira ndalama

translation.en: Union leaders have angrily reacted to the Zimbabwean governments announcement Sunday that workers who have not been vaccinated against COVID-19 will no longer be allowed at work and will not be paid. This is seen as part of efforts to deal with high vaccination hesitancy in the southern African nation. .
translation.nya: Atsogolero a mgwirizano mokwiya ayankhapo pa zomwe boma la Zimbabwe linalengeza lamulungu kuti ogwira ntchito omwe sanabayitse katemera wa Covid 19 sadziloledwa kugwira ntchito ndipo sadzilipilidwa. Izi zikuonedwa ngati njira yopangitsa anthu ambili omwe akuzengereza kukabayitsa ku mmwera kwa Afrika kuti abayitse.

translation.en: Ndabaningi Nick Mangwana, Zimbabwes secretary for information, over the weekend told government-controlled media that all civil servants who have not been vaccinated against COVID-19 will not be allowed to work come Monday.
translation.nya: Ndabaningi Nick Mangwana amene ndi mlembi wa oulutsa nkhani, kumapeto kwasabataku anauza nyumba zoulutsa nkhani zoyendetsedwa ndi boma kuti onse ogwira htchito m'boma amene sanabayitse katenera wa COVID-19 sadziloledwa kugwira ntcito kuyambira lolemba.

translation.en: "There is no extension to the deadline of 15 October, when civil servants are expected to all having been vaccinated, failure of which those who are not vaccinated would not be allowed to work. And further to that is the fact that those who are not vaccinated and those who are not working will not be paid because the thrust is that if you do not work, you dont get paid," he said.
translation.nya: "Palibe kuonjezera masiku kuli konse kuchoka pa 15 October pamene ogwira ntchito m'boma onse akuyembekezereka kukhala atabayitsa katemera wa COVID -19, kulephera kutero kwa osabaitsa sadzaloledwa kugwira ntchito. Kaphatikizira pamenepo kuti omwe sanabayitse ndipo sakugwira ntchitosadzalandira ndalama chifukwa nkhani ndi yakuti ngati sunagwire ntchito usalipilidwe," iye anatero.

translation.en: Schoolteachers, who constitute the largest proportion of Zimbabwes civil servants, say the Friday deadline the government set was unilateral.
translation.nya: Aphunzitsi a masukulu omwe ndi gawo lalikulu la ogwira ntchito m'boma ku Zimbabwe, ati tsiku lomaliza la lachisanu lomwe boma linanena anapanga a boma okha osakhudza iwo

translation.en: "Fundamentally, there was no agreement over the issue of vaccination," said Takavafira Zhou, president of Progressive Teachers Union of Zimbabwe. "Our position as workers has always remained that we encourage our members to be vaccinated. But by no means should our encouragement be misconstrued for mandatory vaccination. Our position is very clear: vaccination must be voluntary. Not mandatory. We must invest in the efficacy of vaccination — explaining to members how vaccination would assist them in terms of boosting their immunity but that has not been done."
translation.nya: Momwe zimakhalira, panalibepo mgwirizano okhudzana ndinkhani ya katemera," anatero Takavafira Zhou, mkulu wa bungwe la wa aphunzitsi la Progressive Teachers Union of Zimbabwe."Mfundo yathu ngati ogwira ntchito nthawi zonse timalimbikitsa anthu athu kuti akabayitse. Koma pasapezeke njira iliyonse yomwe chilimbikitso chomwe timapelekachi chitengedwe molakwika kuti chikhale lamulo kwa liyense kuti akabayitse katemera. Ganizo lathu ndi lomveka bwino: kubayitsa kukhale chisankho cha munthu osati lamulo. Tigwilire ncthito kufunikira kwa katemera-kufotokozera anthu athu momwe katemera amawathandizira iwo pokulitsa chitetezo cha mthupi mwawo koma zimenezi sizinachitidwe."

translation.en: Zimbabwes government says it has fully vaccinated 2,472,859 people since the program started in February.
translation.nya: Boma la Zimbabwe lati labaya katenmera kwathunthu anthu okwanira 2,472,859 chiyambireni dongosololi linayambira mu February

translation.en: Zhou said Zimbabweans were shunning vaccinations for several reasons that the government must first understand, from religious reasons to lack of knowledge about COVID-19 vaccines to lack of trust in the imported Chinese SINOVAC and SINOPHARM vaccines.
translation.nya: Zhou anati anthu aku Zimbabwe amathawa kubayitsa katemera pa zifukwa zambili zomwe boma likuyenera kumvetsetsa kaye kuchokera ku zifukwa za zipembedzo zokhudzana ndi kusowekera chidziwitso pa nkhani za katemera wa COVID-19 kufikira pa kusowa chikhulupiliro cha pa katemera wopangidwa ndi anthu a ku China wotchedwa SINOVAC ndi SINOPHARM

translation.en: He said all civil servants must continue coming to work while unions were considering going to court over purported dismissals.
translation.nya: Iye anati ogwira ntchito m'boma onse apitilize kupita ku ncthito pamene bungweli likuganizira zopita ku bwalo la milandu pa nkhani ya ganizo lofuna kuwachotsa ntchito

translation.en: "The members will only stop going to work if there is a formal letter from the Public Service Commission dismissing them. But even with that formal letter, it will still be challenged because its legality must also be established. But as of now the teachers still remain at their stations, demotivated of course, shimmering in poverty and misery but they remain employees of the government," he said.
translation.nya: Anthuwa asiya kupita ku ntchito ngati pali kalata yowachotsa ntchito yochokera ku ma ofesi a boma a Public Service Commission. Komabe ingakhake kalatayi itapelekedwa, idzafunsidwabe pakuti lamulo lomwe likutsatidwa lidzayenera lioneke.Koma pakanali pano, aphunzitsi apitilira kupita ku malo awo antchito, obwezedwa mbuyo ndithu, ovutitika mu umphawi  komanso zosautsa koabe akhalabe ogwilira ntchito boma," iye anatero.

translation.en: Zimbabwe currently has 132,333 confirmed coronavirus infections and 4,657 deaths, according to the Johns Hopkins Coronavirus Resource Center, which tracks the global outbreak. Civil servants — especially teachers — have long complained about lack of adequate protective equipment in classrooms to curb the spread of COVID-19. Zimbabwes government, however, maintains it is providing enough resources in the fight against the pandemic.
translation.nya: Pakali pano athu omwe anadziwika kuti anapezeka ndi kachirombo ka Corona ku Zimbabwe alipo okwanira 132,333 komanso anthu omwalira ndi akchiromboka okwira 4,657 kutengera zotsatira zopezedwandi a Hopkins Coronavirus Resource Center, omwe amautsata mliliwu. Ogwira ncthito m'boma makamaka aphunzitsi anayambira kalekale kudandaura kukhudzana ndi kusoweka kwa zipangizo zokwanira zozitetezera mu kalasi pochepetsa kufalikira kwa COVID -19. Boma la Zimbabwe komabe likupitilizakunena kuti likupeleka ziangizo zokwanira polimbana ndi mliliwu.

translation.en: New Zealand Cricket Team Cancels Pakistan Tour Over Security Concerns
translation.nya: Gulu losewera masewera acricket yakanika kupita kukaona ku Pakistan kamba ka chitetezo

translation.en: A New Zealand cricket team announced it was abandoning its tour of Pakistan, citing security concerns Friday, the day it was supposed to have its first match.   "Following an escalation in the New Zealand Government threat levels for Pakistan, and advice from NZC security advisers on the ground, it has been decided the BLACKCAPS will not continue with the tour," a press statement from the New Zealand cricket team said.
translation.nya: Gulu losewera masewero a cricket la ku New Zealand lalengeza kutaya ulendo wokayendera Pakistan,potchura chfukwa cha mantha pa nkhani ya chitetezo la chisanu lapitali lomwe linali tsiku limene limayenera kukhala ndi masewero awo oyambilira, kutsatira kukura mulingo kwa chiopsezo kuboma la New  zealand ndi Pakistan, komanso uphungu ochokera  kwa mulangizi wa chitetezo wa NZC yemwe akuyanganira, kwapangidwa chiganizo kuti BLACKCAP  sapitilira ndi ulendo wawo. zinayankhulidwa kuchokera  ku gulu la masewero a clicket la New zealand anataero.

translation.en: Pakistani officials reacted strongly, calling the decision "unilateral" and a conspiracy against Pakistans image.   "None of our various intelligence agencies had received any indication of a security threat," said Pakistans Interior Minister Sheikh Rasheed Ahmed.   He added that Pakistan had offered to hold the matches without spectators, but the offer was rejected.  Pakistani Federal Minister for Maritime Affairs Ali Haider Zaidi said he was "appalled" at the decision.   "Sadly, global politics has won over the great game of cricket! There were no security threats! @jacindaardern," he said, tagging the New Zealand prime minister in his tweet.
translation.nya: Akulu akuluaku Pakistan anayankha mokwiya ,  kunena chiganizocho, "ndichambali imodzi" komanso coononga chithunzi thunzi cha Pakistan. " Palibe aliyense wa gulu la zachitetezo athu omwe analandilapo chizindikiro chilichonse  choopsea chitetezo.,  Nduna Sheikh Rasheed Ahmed anatero. Anaonjezera kuti ofesi yawo yaikulu ya Pakistan idadzipeleka kupangitsa masewero  popanda  oonelera,  koma anakana ganizori.   Pakistani Federal Minister forMaritime Affairs Ali Haider Zaidi  adati iye adakhumudwa pachiganizochi. " Mokwiya"  a global politics anawina pama sewero akulu a clicket! panalibepo chiopsezo pachitetezo! pa jacindaardem, " anatero pouza nduna yaku New zealand patamba lawo lamchezo la tweeter.

translation.en: Prime Minister Imran Khan personally called Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern to guarantee the teams safety, but she stood by her teams decision, according to Ahmed and the Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB).   The PCB said it had arranged "fool proof security" for the visiting team and New Zealand security officials had been satisfied with their arrangements.   "[C]ricket lovers in Pakistan and around the world will be disappointed by this last-minute withdrawal," the board said.   The chief executive of the Black Caps, David White, said he could not ignore the advice he was receiving.   "I understand this will be a blow for the PCB, who have been wonderful hosts, but player safety is paramount, and we believe this is the only responsible option," he said.   The two sides were to play three one-day matches in Rawalpindi, known as the twin city of the Pakistani capital, Islamabad, followed by a series of five limited over matches or T-20s in Pakistans second-largest city, Lahore.
translation.nya: Nduna Imran Khan paiye yekha anaitana nduna Jcinda Ardern kutsimikizira za chitetezo cha magulu amasewero, koma iwo anakhalabe kuchiganizo cha gulu lawo lamasewero,kumbali ya Ahamed komanso Pakistani Cricket Board(PCB). Bungwe la PCB anati anakonza chitetezo champhamvu kwambri "kwa magulu amasewero obwera ndipo akulu akulu chitetezo aku New zealand akanakhutitsidwa ndi madongosolo. Anthu okonda masewero a cricket ku New zealand komanso pandiko lonse akhala okhumudwa ndichiganizo chobwera nthawi yotha itha kukana kusewera, "oyang'anira zamasewerowa anatero.Wamkulu oyang'anira  Black Caps, David White, anati sakanatha kukana uphungu omwe amalandira.  Ndikumvetsetsa kuti ichi chikhara chopweteka kwa PCB, Omwe akhara akuyendetsa, koma chitetezo kwa osewera ndichofunikira kwmbiri,  ndipo tikukhulupilira kuti ichi ndiye chinali chisankho choyenera, anatero. MBli ziwirizi zimayenera kusewera masewero atattu tsiku limodzi ku Rawalpindi, yomwe imadziwika nndi dzina loti twin city  mu mzinda waukulu waku Pakistani,Islamabad,motsogozana ndi masewero olumikizana a  five limited over kapena  t-20s  mumzinda waukulu wachiwiri ku Pakistani, Lahore.

translation.en: The chief executive of the PCB, Wasim Khan, told VOA the New Zealand team would head home Saturday on a chartered plane.   An English cricket team was scheduled to visit Pakistan in October, but Interior Minister Ahmed said that tour also was now in doubt.   "Ministry of Interior has informed me that the English team is also thinking along the same lines. On our part, we are ready to welcome them. There is no security threat in our country to either New Zealand or England," he said.   International cricket teams stopped visiting Pakistan after an attack on a Sri Lankan cricket team in 2009 in Lahore that wounded seven members of the team.   Pakistan went through several years of violence starting approximately in 2007 as extremist groups blaming Pakistan for siding with the United States in its war on terror started attacking both its security forces and civilians.   Pakistani officials claim up to 80,000 of their citizens died in these attacks, and the country suffered up to $150 billion worth of damage to its economy.   In 2016, Pakistani cricket authorities formed the Pakistan Super League, six cricket teams representing six cities. The teams included international players in an effort to revive international cricket in Pakistan. The first two seasons of the league were played outside Pakistan in the United Arab Emirates.   The first international team to return to Pakistan was Zimbabwe in 2015.
translation.nya: Wamkulu oyang'anira bungwe la PCB, Wasim Khan, wauza VOA kuti gulu lawo lamaswero  lidzibwelera kwawo Loweluka pa ndege yawo yapadera. Gulu la masewero a cricket ya azungu inauzidwa kuti izabwere ku Pakistani mu October, Koma nduna Alhamed wti ulendo umenewonso pakali pano ndiokaikitsa.Unduna wa zamkatiwandidziwitsa  ine kuti gulu lamasewero la azunguli nalonso  likuganiza mofanana nawo. Kumbali yathu ife ndiokomzeka kuwalandira. palibe chiopsezo chilichonse cha chitetezo mudziko lathu ungakhale ku New zealand  kapenanso ku England, " iye anatero. magulu amasewero a cricket amaiko anasiya kupita ku Pakistani chifukwa cha chiwembu chomwe  chinachitikira  gulu lamasewero  a criket la Sri Lankan mu 2009 ku Lahore  komwe kunavulala osewera agululi okwana asanu ndi awiri.  Pakistani yadutsa dzaka zambiri  mudzipolowe kuambira chamma 2007 pamene gulu lina la mtundu wa anthu sili magwilizana ndi pakistani pokhala mbali imodzi ndi  United States mu nkhondo yawo pomwe zifwamba zinayamba  limbana ndi onse achitetezo komanso anthu wamba. Akulu akulu aboma la  Pakistani anati  mzika zawo zoposera 80,000 zafa paziwembuzo, ndipo dziko lazunzika ndikuonongeka kwa chuma chawo choposera $150 billion. Mu 2016 akulu akulu acriket anapanga bungwe la Pakistani Super League, magulu oswera okwana asanu ndi imodzi amaimilira mizinda isanu ndi umodzi. mgagulu osewerawa amaphatikiza osewera akunja mukuyesetsa kofuna kudzutsanso masewero a criket amaiko akunja ku Pakistan. Zigawo ziwiri zamasewerowo zimaseweredwa kunja kwa Pakistanku United Arab Emirates.Gulu lamasewero loyamba kubwelera ku Pakistan linali Zimbabwe mu 2015

translation.en: African Leaders Discuss Ways to Minimize Impact of Climate Change
translation.nya: Atsogoleri amu Africa akambirana njira zochepetsera kuonongeka kwa kusintha kwa nyengo.

translation.en: High-level African officials met virtually this week to discuss the challenges Africa faces in trying to manage a growing population amid climate change. The conference was aimed at identifying ways African governments can manage these pressures to minimize or avoid conflict.
translation.nya: Akulu akulu  amulingu wapamwamba a m'boma anakumana  mowilikiza sabata ino  pokambirana mavuto omwe Africa akukumana nawo  pofuna kukomza kukura kwa chiwelengero cha anthu pamabali yakusintha kwa nyengo. Mkumanawu cholinga chake kunali  kupeza njira zomwe maboma amu Africa  angatahnirane ndimavuto amenewa pochepetsa kapena kupewa mkangano..

translation.en: Africa generates about 3% percent of global greenhouse gas emissions, the lowest of any continent. But its more vulnerable than any other region in the world, since Africans depend so heavily on their natural environment for food, water and medicine.
translation.nya: Africa imapanga pafupifupi 3% ya malo omwe amachotsa mpweya oipa mulengalenga, ali pansi pa makomtineti onse, koma ndizosafunikira kwambiri kusiyana ndi zigawo zonse zapa dzikolapansi, pakuti Africa imadalira kwambiri pa zachilengedwa chawo pa zakudya, madzi komanso mankhwala.

translation.en: Speaking at a virtual conference Tuesday on climate, conflict and demographics in Africa, Nigerian Vice President Yemi Osinbajo said African governments need to keep the climate in mind as they try to boost their economies.
translation.nya: Kuyankhula pa mkumano wa pakanema Lchiwiri pa zanyengo,  mikangano ndi chiwelengero cha anthu mu Africa,  wachiwiri wa mtsogoliri wa dziku la Nigeria Yemi Osibanjo anati amaboma amu Africa akuyenera kumaganizira za nyengo pamene akuyesera kukweza chuma chawo.

translation.en: "Our first obligation for us and for African countries must always be to ensure the well-being of our people through access to development services, including electricity, health care, education, safe jobs and a safe environment, including access to clean cooking fuels. We must prioritize solutions that align the development and climate agenda, and that is absolutely important," said Osinbajo.
translation.nya: Undindo wathu oyambilira  wa ife ndi maiko amu Africa  ukuyenera nthawi zonse kukhara  owonetsetsa  chisamaliro cha anthu anthu kudzera pakupeza zithandizo zapamwamba, kuphatikizilapo magetsi, thandizo la zaumoyo, maphunziro, ncthito zotetezeka komanso  malo achitetezo kupatikiza mafuta ophikira abwino, Tikuyenera titsogoze  myankho omwe ali ogwilizana ndi chitukuko komanso ali ndi cholinga cha zanyengo, ndipo ichi ndichofunikira kwambiri, anatero Osinbajo.

translation.en: The Center for Research on the Epidemiology of Disasters, based in Brussels, says that in 2019, Africa recorded 56 extreme weather events compared to 45 in the previous year.
translation.nya: Bungwe la Center for Research on the Epidemiology of Disasters, lomwe lili ku Brussels, linanena izi mu 2019, Africa yapezeka ndikuvuta kwakukulu kwa nyengo  ndi mulingo wa 56 kusiyana ndi  45 pa mulingo wa zaka za mmbuyo .

translation.en: The extreme weather patterns affected the lives of 16.6 million people in 29 countries. At least 13 million of them were from five countries: Kenya, Mozambique, Somalia, Tanzania and Zimbabwe.
translation.nya: kuchita kwa nyengo yovutayi kwa khudza miyoyo ya anthu 16.6 miliyoni mmaiko 29. pafupifupi 13 milliyon mwa iwo anali ochokera ku maiko asanu: Kenya, Mozambique, Somalia, Tanzania ndi Zimbabwe.

translation.en: West Africa had fewer weather-related catastrophes but is feeling the effects of global warming just the same.
translation.nya: chigawo chakumadzulo cha Africa chili ndi nyengo zoononga zochepa komabe  vuto lakuonongeka kwa mpweya wamulengalenga kukumawakhudza chimodzi modzi.

translation.en: Ghana environment minister Kwaku Afriyie explains how climate change has impacted agricultural lands in the country.
translation.nya: Nduna yoona za nyengo ku Ghana Kwaku Afriyie anafotokoza momwe kusintha kwa nyengo kwa khudzira malo aulimi mdzikomo.

translation.en: "The harsh and deteriorating climate conditions in northern Ghana undoubtedly energized region-growing food insecurity and seasonal north-to-south migration. And besides, increasing of floods and protracted drought lead to displacement of people. Statistics show that over the last few years, there has been a new internal displacement which has occurred in Ghana due to climate-induced disasters and even beyond our borders," he said.
translation.nya: "Kuvuta ndikupitilira kwa kuvuta kwa nyengo yoononga ku mpoto kwa Ghana mosakaikitsa zionjezera kukula kwa kusowa chakudya ndipo zipangitsa anthu kuchoa ku mpoto kupita ku mwera. Ndipo kupatura izikuchuluka kwa madzi osefukula ndikukhalitsa kwa chilara kupangitsa anthu kusamuka. Kalembera wa anthu anaonetsa izi zaka zochepa zapitazo,pakhala kusamuka kwa mkati komwe kawchitika ku Ghana chifukwa chakuchitika kwa ngozi zadzidzi  ngakhalenso kudutsa  zipata zathu, Iye anatero.

translation.en: The U.N. special representative to the African Union, Hannah Tetteh, said the continent needs to improve cross-border information-sharing and cooperation to handle climate-related crises.
translation.nya: Katswiri oimilira  maiko amu  United Nations (U.N) ku maiko amu mgwiriano wa mu Africa ( African Union) Hannah Tetteh,  anati kontineti ikufunika kupititsa patsogolo njira zofalitsira nkhani kunja ndi mgwirizano okonza  zokhudzana ndikuvuta kwa nyengo.

translation.en: "The challenge has not been that we havent developed yet these structures. The challenge has been we have not utilized them yet effectively, and that goes to issues of national sovereignty and the unwillingness of member states to have others, as it were, take an active interest and maybe recommend the things that need to be done in order to respond to a particular crisis. And if we recognize we are all in this together, then that certainly has to change," she said.
translation.nya: "Sikuti vuto lakhala kuti sitinamange zinthu zimenezi. Vuto lakhala kuti sitinazigwilitsebe ntchito bwino, izizi zikulozabenkhani ya umodzi mdziko komanso kusowekera kwa kufuna kwa anthu a mu dziko kukhala nawo ena monga zinalili kukhala nacho chidwi chochitachita komanso mwina kulangiza zinthu zomwe tingachite kuti tigonjetse vuto lina lake. Ndipo ngati tingazindikire tili limodzimu izi, kenako zinthuzi zikuyenera kusintha," iye anatero.

translation.en: As for specific suggestions, Osinbajo suggested governments encourage greater use of natural gas and plant more trees to maintain forests that can soak up carbon dioxide and prevent it from warming the atmosphere.
translation.nya: Pa maganizo apaderadera, Osinbajo anapeleka maganizo akuti boma limalimbikitsa kugwiritsa ntchito mpweya wa chilengedwe komanso kubzyala mitengo ndicholinga chosunga nkhalango zomwe zimayamwa mpweya oyipa wa carbondioxide komanso kupewetsa kuetentha kwa dziko lonse komwe kumadza ndi kuonongeka kwa bulangete ya mlengalenga.

translation.en: Young Africans Struggle With Jobs, Education Amid Pandemic
translation.nya: Achinyamata aku Afrika avutika ndi ntchito, mapahunziro mkatikati mwa mlili

translation.en: The future looked promising for Tinashe Mapuranga, an intern at a leading bank in Zimbabwe who appeared set to get a staff position as soon as he completed his college degree. Then the COVID-19 pandemic hit.
translation.nya: Tsogolo limkaoneka lowala pa Tinashe Mapuranga, ophunzira ntchito pa nkhokwe ya ndalama (bank) yotsogola ku Zimbabwe yemwe anaoneka kuti adzapeza mwayi olembedwa ntchito pompo akamaliza maphunziro ake a ukachenjede. Patatha izi mlili wa COVID 19 unakantha.

translation.en: Amid the lockdowns, the 24-year-old was one of the first to be laid off and has no idea when he'll be able to get his degree because of frequent school closures.
translation.nya: Mkatikati mwa kutseka zipata zolowera mmayiko, wachinyamata wa zaka 24 yu anali mmodzi mwa omwe anachotsedwa ndipo alibe chiyembekezo pa nthawi ya kumaliza maphunziro ake chifukwa cha kutsekatseka kwa masukulu

translation.en: "It has really affected me a lot in my studies. I have no money to buy data and I don't have a personal laptop to study online and keep up like what others are doing," said Mapuranga, who lives with his mother in Chitungwiza, a sprawling working-class area southeast of Harare, the capital.
translation.nya: "Izi zandisokoneza kwambili paphunziro anga ndithu. Ndilibe ndalama zogulira mayunitsi a pa intaneti(data) komanso ndilibe laptop yangayanga kuti ndikwanitse kuphunzira nawo pa intaneti ndikupitiliza kuphunzira monga azanga akuchitira.," anatero Mapuranga, amene amakhala ndi mai ake ku Chitungwiza, dera lomwe lili ndi anthu ambili odalira maganyu kummawa kwa ku mwera kwa Harare, likulu la dzikoli.

translation.en: "I was supposed to finish in November or December 2021, but as of now, we haven't completed much of the work," he said. "Truly speaking, I am not sure when I will finish the degree. I can't wait to graduate and find a job and do something tangible in life."
translation.nya: "Ndimayenera kumaliza mu Novembara chaka cha 2021 koma pakanali pano, sitinaphunzire zambili," Iye anatero. " Kunena zoona, sindikudziwa kuti ndimaliza liti maphunziroanga a sukulu ya ukachenjede. Ndikufunitsitsa nditamaliza komanso ndikupeza ntchito , kenako ndikuchita zinthu zooneka mmoyo."

translation.en: Mapuranga spends most of his time at home, tending a tiny vegetable garden that is the family's main source of food. His mother ekes out a living traveling to South Africa to sell things like stone carvings and brooms on the streets, a trade also badly hit by the pandemic.
translation.nya: Nthawi yambili ya Mapuranga amakhala ku nyumba, kusamalira kadimba ka masamba komwe banja lakwawo limapezerapo chakudya. Mayi ake amazithandizira mmoyo wawo popita ku dziko la South AFRICA kukagulitsa ziboliboli. Ndi masache mmiseu, amodzi a malonda omwe akhudzidwa kwambili ndi mliliwu.

translation.en: "We've been trying to hustle to get some money," he said. "I tried to do a small business selling cooking gas but the authorities chased us away from the streets. My father passed away. My mother is into informal business, but it's also down with these lockdowns. Things are not well right now. It's tough."
translation.nya: "Takhala tikuyesetsa kugwira ntchito molimbika kuti tipeze ndalama," iye anatero. Ndinayesera kupanga malonda aang'ono ogulitsa nkhuni mu misewu koma adindo anatithamangitsamo. Bambo anga anamwalira. Mayi anga machita malonda osakhazikika omwe nawo ayima kamba kakutseka zipata za mayiko. Zinthu sizili bwino pakali pano. zathina."

translation.en: Mapuranga's situation might look dire, but he says he's concerned about some of his unemployed peers who have fallen into alcohol, drugs and prostitution.
translation.nya: Nyengo ya Mapuranga itha kumaoneka yakakasi, koma iye wati ali nkdi nkhawa chifukwa cha amzake omwe samagwira ntchito omwe atayikira ku mowa, mankhwala ozunguza ubongo komanso uhule.

translation.en: "Many youths have lost hope," he said.
translation.nya: "Achinyamata ambili ataya chiyembekezo," iye natero

translation.en: Across Africa, many others like Mapuranga are battling the economic downturn caused by COVID-19, losing jobs and seeing their education disrupted, a survey of people aged 18-24 in 15 countries has found.
translation.nya: Mu Afrika, ambili ofanana ndi Mapurangaakuvutika mndi kuvuta kwa chuma komwe kwadza chufkwa cha COVID-19, kutha kwa ntchito komanso kuona kusokonezedwa kwa maphunziro awo, kafukufuku waanthu a zaka za pakti pa 18 ndi 24 mu mayiko 15 wapeza zimenezi.

translation.en: The pandemic increased the already-high level of unemployment among the group, according to preliminary findings of the second annual Africa Youth Survey.
